elements.title: 1886 eruption of Mount Tarawera (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that ash fall from the 1886 eruption of Mount Tarawera (pictured) was reported on ships nearly 1,000 kilometres (620 mi) out to sea?

elements.title: Dylan Cook (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that National Football League player Dylan Cook went from being the quarterback to protecting the quarterback?

elements.title: three X and two Y chromosomes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that there have been eight known males with three X and two Y chromosomes?

elements.title: Georg Forchhammer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1903, Georg Forchhammer invented a system to help his deaf students see the sounds of spoken Danish?

elements.title: Spiritbox (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after their 2020 tour was cancelled due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Spiritbox received $10,000 from Shinedown's Brent Smith, a stranger, to cover losses?

elements.title: BattleSphere (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the developers of BattleSphere pledged to donate all profits from sales to diabetes research?

elements.title: Roy W. Ritner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during World War I, Roy W. Ritner was elected unopposed to the Oregon State Senate while serving with the American Red Cross in France?

elements.title: their bulletin board (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Athenians built their bulletin board with a surprising lack of precision?
